snippet: Federal prosecutors said a Memphis educator paid teachers to take qualifying exams for others in three states who were afraid they would not pass.
abstract: Memphis educator Clarence D Mumford pleads guilty to charges that he was cheating ring mastermind, during his 23-year career, in which he paid teachers to take national teacher certification exams for others;  case rattles Memphis at time when city's schools are merging with suburban district, exposing tensions over race and economic disparity.

byline.contributor: John Branston contributed reporting from Memphis, and Alain Delaquérière from New York.

lead_paragraph: Federal prosecutors said a Memphis educator paid teachers to take qualifying exams for others in three states who were afraid they would not pass.

headline.seo: Teachers Accused of Cheating on Qualifying Exams
headline.main: In a Memphis Cheating Ring, the Teachers Are the Accused
headline.print_headline: In a Memphis Cheating Ring, the Teachers Are the Accused
